labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is primarily focused on image generation and editing using OpenAI's Image API. It allows users to create images from text prompts and edit existing images, with functionality for asynchronous processing. The server also integrates with S3-compatible storage for managing image assets. This indicates capabilities in media generation, API-based interactions, and storage management.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality centered around image creation and editing with AI prompts fits best under "Content Creation" and "Media Generation". The secondary label of "AI/ML Tools" is appropriate due to reliance on OpenAI's models. Cloud storage integration justifies "Cloud Services" as another secondary label. No unique functionality warrants a custom label beyond predefined categories.

server_info_crawled.name: OpenAI Image API Server
server_info_crawled.author: @GaussianGuaicai/MCP-OpenAI-ImageAPI
server_info_crawled.overview: Generate and edit images using text prompts and input images with OpenAI's GPT-Image-1 API. Automatically manage image storage and retrieval via S3-compatible object storage. Enable asynchronous image generation and editing through a FastAPI-based MCP server.

tools.name: generate_image
tools.description: Deploy Server OpenAI Image API Server Claim Server @GaussianGuaicai/MCP-OpenAI-ImageAPI Try in Playground generate_image

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@GaussianGuaicai/MCP-OpenAI-ImageAPI/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
